comment.author: 23492747@N04
comment._content: Not one of the most aesthetically pleasing designs of locomotive to ply its trade on Portugal's railways (lol!) - but you never know, there are some very obsessive diesel lovers out there and for all I know, this is someone's favourite vintage class of loco!

comment.author: 43495746@N05
comment._content: In fact this locomotive didn't ply its trade on Portugal's railways.  It was one of a sanctions busting design by Alsthom for Rhodesia which were assembled at Sorefame.  There were 54 of them, built between 1972 and 1977.  Note that the gauge was 3'6", compared with Portugals 5'6".

comment.author: 23492747@N04
comment._content: Very interesting - thanks for that information; Idon't suppose they looked as pristine as this after a few years of bashing their way through the Rhodesian bush with minimal maintenance!

comment.author: 23492747@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the link - very interesting!
